title: Understanding First-Generation Antipsychotics
text: First-generation antipsychotics, also known as typical antipsychotics, were developed in the 1950s and are primarily used to treat schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders.

title: Characteristics of First-Generation Antipsychotics
text: These medications are known for their dopamine receptor antagonism, which helps reduce symptoms like hallucinations and delusions.

title: Examples of First-Generation Antipsychotics
text: Some common first-generation antipsychotics include haloperidol, trifluoperazine, thioridazine, and fluphenazine.

title: Identify First-Generation Antipsychotics
text: Which of the following are first-generation antipsychotics?
choices: aripiprazole, asenapine, brexpiprazole, cariprazine, clozapine, iloperidone, lumateperone, lurasidone, olanzapine, paliperidone, pimavanserin, quetiapine, risperidone, and ziprasidone
